intro: Ambulia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered ambulia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and climbers. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Ambulia micrantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
